comments.body:
I support this idea!

While it will make the acquisition of string trivial, without having Sheep, Loom and, maybe, Sticks, it won't be as easy.

So basically, my idea was is that a player rolls Wool into String by the use of sticks (think the distaff). In the process, sticks are consumed. Maybe also add the ability to color string (colored tripwires for extra sneaky wire traps?)
I have such a hard time collecting string and have thought that we should be able to craft string from wool. Just like crafting wool from string. We can make hay into hay bales and vice versa.

Agreed! In certain seeds, string is extremely difficult to find in Peaceful mode. I would kind of like to see a new work station for it: Spinning Wheel. I should be able to shear a sheep and spin it into string. Short of that, just making string craftable on the crafting table or loom would suffice.

This should definitely be a thing! I like the idea of crafting a "Distaff" on the Crafting Table with wool blocks and sticks, and then using that item on a new Spinning Wheel workstation to spin String.

Please!  Crafting STRING would go a long way to filling an alternate way to get string that doesn't coerce players with aversions to the dark and jump scares to have to wait up all night or go caving.  As a way to balance it and prevent an exploitable loop:  3 wool make one string.  It's costly but I for one would find it worthwhile. 

Regards.

i would love this! hunting spiders is too much trouble when they wont spawn enough. and all i keep getting is zombies and skeletons. i need string to be more easily accessable, plus it feels like the loom is just going unused because nobody actualy need banners from what i seee, they are just decoration. the loom could easily be used to make string, or even yarn. they could start makeing cloth armour too, or even outfits, or hats.
That's a very nice idea! VERY COOL!
Would be a really good idea, probably even updated brewing recipes book.
yes please!
Agree. Such books could be found in treasuries or bought.
Like the Recipe Book but for Brewing Stand
Make sure to vote for yourself.
Great idea,RadicalLotus606!
Absolutely, I thought this was vanilla already.
That's a legitimately good idea!
It would be nice considering nametags are such a rare item
amzing BRO
Very useful for accidentally naming the wrong mob.
I would love to be able to get the nametag from a beloved pet so i could bury it in their grave.
I don't know why the developers did not add this feature in the first place.
This would be lovely! All it takes is an alternative texture being applied once in a while, but would make things so much prettier!

I think the flowered vines would be an amazing touch to the game because alongside the normal vines, they would look so pretty as decoration or just growing alongside them! While there's already so much color to the game, this would add a lot more!
Yes! Blooming vines would be amazing!

Something this powerful should probably take more than one slimeball.  Maybe at least surround the boots with slimeballs.

This would be amazing in the game, though.
Yeah, maybe even surrounding the boots with slime BLOCKS

Slime blocks would end up being more slime than boots on your feet. x3  But the cost would be high enough.

I assume the intent is that any boots can be turned into a slimy variant?

I do love any suggestion that would make getting around a little easier in a not overpowered way.
I love the idea!
So let me get this right. We have the Turtle Shell for the head, we have the Elytra for the chestplate, and we could have Slime Boots for the feet. I wonder what the special leggins would be?
I think it would be cooler to have a small chance of the slime dropping this item, thus making the search for the mob bigger and making this item (which is a good item) harder to find and more rare
I think the boots should also allow the user to bounce high too(limited by a certain height of course). Slime(not referring to the mob btw) in Minecraft is sticky yes, but they are also bouncy.
It sounds awesome but can we enchant themðŸ¤”
Does it consume the Piston?

Yes, it does. 

But it's not like wood, stone, redstone, and iron are difficult to come by. All of them are renewable anyway.

The crafting recipe strikes me as really weird; the lightning idea, however, not only isn't without precedent, it also strikes me as very well balanced. I've given you my vote, but for the lightning idea only.

I like the lightning idea too.  It's not too early game, since you need to obtain a trident and enchant it properly first.  Although I can just imagine someone using a channeling trident on the catch chamber of a guardian farm x3

I think that the 2nd idea might be a way too easy solution to get sponges, one would even be able to get them without even visiting ocean monuments

The 1st idea however seems fine. Got my vote.

I absolutely agree with the lightning transformation. It still makes sponges very rare but able to be renewable with the proper set up. The set up also being difficult to make so it is still very rare. I see what you are saying for the crafting recipe but it is a little strange. Too strange for people to understand. Even if I looked up how sponges are made irl I would still be confused by the recipe.

Here's my idea for a crafting recipe:

  • Wood planks - pulp
  • Grass, mined with Silk Touch - hemp fiber
  • Nether Quartz - sodium sulfate

This would make sponges harder to craft but still somewhat reasonable.
I agree with guardians being stuck with lightning turning into elder guardians
Mermaids and sharks are both not in the game. What would be the point of these?

Sharks could be a neutral mob that hunts fish, and mermaids could spawn around shipwrecks, being a much more powerful form of a drowned. Tails could be used as a way to make diving shoes, and maybe another source of leather.
Mermaids and sharks are not in the game, though we may never know if the developers decide to add these creatures into the game. A dolphin tale or a guardian tale sound more realistic to the game.
Perhaps there should also be dark powerful magic but after the spell is completed it would kill you

Quite frankly The Magic Update should be the sole focus of 1.18. There's so much potential there...

Creation of a grimoire (spellbook) that contains a set number of spells the user can cast.
Require sleeping to replenish the spells you can cast that day.
Categories: combat, informational, transformation, protection, mining, etc.

Imagine a spell of Greater Mining. Clears out an 8x8x8 region in front of the caster. All blocks dropped. But then you have to sleep in order to cast it again. Perhaps it consumes some reagents as well (8 eggs, 2 lapis, 1 gold nugget. I threw the eggs in there to give them some other purpose... :-)

The potential is mind-boggling.
The magic update will be possibly the greatest investment after the cave update

A new dimension that holds ghost and spirits and you can get it items that are useless unless you use an imbuement table similar to the enchanting table but stronger and you can store a single item in it and the item will be displayed over it almost like an item frame but you can use items to make new items like a bow + fishing rod can make something similar to a grappling hook and there can be a crossbow variant but an entire magic update would be awesome!
i think for a magic update they should add a way to make youre elytra look different
I feel like some sort of staff made with gold/amethyst that uses lapis for ammo or something. Maybe the "Spells" could be from different combos of enchantments to really envisize the magic element

But what would these pipes do? What would you use them for? What happens at the end of the pipe? How does water flow through them? Is there a limit to how far the water would flow? What happens if the pipe goes up... does the water flow up? Do these pipes have any interactions with hoppers or other redstone components?

Yeah I think it should be something essentially like a hopper, but with only one input and output (unless L junctions or T junctions are made). This would be a great use for the new ore and it could help with lag from entities or hopper checks but would still allow players to move items. It could connect between hoppers to droppers, dispensers, or to other hoppers and would probably make building farms more compact.
Copper pipes would be useless until they remove infinite water

I like the idea of copper pipes to push water in a certain direction. In this way you could build irrigation for farming, powered water rides, and the possibility for powered full on ships instead of tiny boats. Of course that requires blocks that freely float.

You could add pumps with the pipes if you want to move the water up. At the end you would have a spout that you could turn on or off. Then you could have places to sort out objects like if you were to use the pipes to move blocks like a hopper.
Love this idea. Make them like hoppers only without redstone mechanics, smaller hotboxes, and cheaper construction. Use in the place of hopper pipe systems.

I agree completely! 16 dyes just isnâ€™t enough for most color-themed builds. I personally think there should be 24 total dye colors, with 8 more added to the current 16. The number 24, like 16, is a multiple of 8, and itâ€™s just enough to cover all the colors that should be added in my opinion.

-Crimson (dark red)

-Lavender (light purple)

-Indigo (blue + purple)

-Olive (green + brown)

-Vermillion (orange + red)

-Chartreuse (yellow + lime green)

-Turquoise (light blue + mint green)

-Mint green (light green, even lighter than lime green)

These would be a big improvement for builders and decorators, especially in-game pixel artists. If I had to pick only three dyes to add, I would choose indigo, crimson, and lavender.
I mostly use wool in my builds, so if this gets added I'll be able to add even more colours to my builds.
That has been what I have been wanting for a while and another colour should be light yellow
And the dye origins too! Iron ore as orange, yellow or black dye, copper ore for cyan and either coal or charcoal for black, and baryte for white.
A beige or ivory type dye would also be sooo good! I personally love the chocolate brown and beige color scheme but am so sad that beige isn't in vanilla. Maybe even a navy dye too
Yes! I appreciate them adding other blocks so we have a variety of colors, but we really should have more dyes to begin with, the others are getting old hahah
pls do! i would love to have more dyes :)
I would add some like Peach, cream and Coral. As well as Navy Maroon and Gold
Gold and silver dye
I would absolutely LOVE tan and lavender wool! Maybe even an olive dye coming from olive trees or something.
WE NEED THIS
Minecraft bedrock has only 16 dyes and with the feature that Minecraft java has the ability to make custom colors and Minecraft really needs new colors to use in game like dye depot as a example
Agree at full throttle - richer dyes and lighter dyes!

Looking at some images it seems like sandstone fills this role. but on the same token, it looks like it could add a more shaded, grainy, weathered, and yellowish mustard look to builds. Idk, I'm on the fence. ill vote for it for now
i think this would be a great idea, but if it were to be implemented it would act like granite, diorite, or andesite

It they do a cave update this would be a good addition- it might work best if they also updated how stone formations formed.  You don't get granite stalactites but you do with limestone.  It would be nice if the different stone types formed in patches more like they would in the real world.
At least for in veins like granite etc, for sure. I've always loved the idea of having limestone in Minecraft, even before caves and cliffs was announced.
No Dyeing stone, and they should occur in dripstone caves as this would make sense as well as add another use to the biome.

In real life, Limestone is made of Calcite from the shells of sea creatures.

I think limestone would be a stripped-oak colored sandstone-like block, and would spawn in warm oceans.

Might also be able to be smelted from Calcite.

mebbe ill do a post abt it later.
Would also be cool to add an alternative crafting recipe for cement that includes limestone

Sandstone is NOT a good replacement for limestone. It's so yellow it hurts the eyes. If you ever tried building Parisian/Haussman style or classic buildings you'll know the pain. Quartz is too white as well. This block has been on top of my wishlist for Minecraft since 2011 and I was really disappointed it wasn't in Caves and Cliffs or the Wild update.
maybe Brutes should drop gold lining, or an item you can put togheter with any armor to make a gilded version of it. brutes need some drop anyway
30 blocks are way too much it should just be one

I would rather then it take a lot of gold (like 1  ingot or so)and other stuff to make it it would just lower the durability and some of the effect of netherite and make it in between diamond and netherite
Thanks for the feedback on my feedback! I do agree that 30 blocks is a lot, but I couldn't seem to find another way for it to be expensive, but also not be crafted in some ridiculous way.

I think 4 gold blocks arranged around the netherite armor in a crafting table or a gold block in the smithing table with the armor piece and it wouldnt affect durability unless by a small bit removed and it would add golden lines to the armor just to make it look a bit nicer.
I think netherite armor deserves gold lining anyway, since each ingot is made with half gold.

How about just one block of gold because remember, each block is one cubic meter and the player is two blocks tall. Plus your only gilding the armor not covering it in gold, logically 30 cubic meters of gold would be to much.
i mean why don't you add a stack of gilded black stone i mean it is rarer than netherite
30 blocks is way to expensive. You should also be able to gild other types of armor (other than gold) to decorate it and earn respect from piglins.
AMAZING!

Sounds kinda basic, I would like to hear a crafting recipe or how it works.
Crafting: 5 glass blocks in a minecart like style, water bucket in center (u get the bucket back)
Use: only tropical fish can be placed inside they kinda swim around but donâ€™t have much room to move.
I like this. Simple, but great for decoration
But fish bowls are illegal because it's animal cruelty.

397107024912

In real life, yes they are cruel, but this is a virtual game where nothing has feelings or emotions. The fish is not actually experiencing cruelty.

YES FISHBOWL. Except -- it has to be the 1x1 size, so it should not take up as much space as all the diy aquariums people make. It can just have water in it and then you can put in whatever fish you want to house in it. No more than 2 fish should be able to fit in there (or 1 fish and 1 coral). And also, what if you can make a mossy/dirty fish tank by crafting the original fishbowl but then adding seagrass anywhere on the grid next to it?
Maybe coming from combining quartz and basalt.
Maybe it could also have another special purpose like smoke particles, or furnaces run faster when placed on it
Can it be used to make a yo yo weapon?
Perhaps this could have a use in building, as well as a way to craft a new item?
In real life, non-irridiated Smoky Quartz is transparent to translucent. Perhaps if this idea is chosen it can be used to make easy black stained glass?

I think idea for Durability is interesting... But it might ruin a bunch of machinery dependent on Buckets tho and I don't think people would like that if you don't give alternatives for it... Yes you don't need buckets for a lot of things if you want to be cheap with your creations (Piston blocking flow of water will do fine in most cases), but you can't for example Put buckets in Dispensers hidden behind let's say a staircase for hidden water disposal,

Instead of durability I'm proposing to go more into storage capability.
While it wouldn't work much for Iron and Gold Buckets (because how you decide which one should carry more liquids? Maybe Gold because it could be "enchanted"/"magical" and it is more precious? Maybe Iron because it's more durable and can withstand more pressure, it's also harder metal in general), but could fit nicely into Netherite Bucket which could definitely hold way more of liquid because it's... well, more durable than Iron and Gold?
Storing and moving liquids could be amazing if you could hold like... I don't know... 10 blocks of Liquids in one slot?

You could use Durability bar to show how much of liquid is in Bucket instead - Iron and Gold bucket could hold 1 cubic meter of liquids, while Netherite bucket - let's say 10 because Netherite is super rare and we need more purpose for this Alloy (because let's face it - Netherite is an Alloy, Ancient Debre could be classified as "Ore").
Why not just make the gold bucket be able to carry two blocks of liquid, and the nether items three?

I pretty strongly disagree with this, seems like a change for change's sake. I think buckets are just fine as they are, but if they were to add more types of buckets, I'd personally rather them just carry more liquid.

I don't like this. Seems like a nerf to the bucket and a waste of netherite. I mean, to get back to a standard bucket, that can now break, you need 12 gold and 12 ancient debris just to move water and lava around. Durability is interesting, but I think that's getting a little too realistic

I think that is a good idea, but instead of just broke the bucket it should meke the bucket worse, like iron, iron rusts, so let's meke a rusted iron bucket, it loses water when used and broke Just when you use it to carry lava
Its a nice idea but i struggle enuff just trying to find iron to have derubility on a bucket is a cool idea so there for ill vote for it

I don't really like the idea because it would ruin alot of redstone contraptions that use water and lava in dispensers. There's ways to fix all of them but it would require a bulkier / less efficient solution. In cases where you can't fit a fill line for more buckets, it would require going back to doing water and lava streams the old way from before dispensers were introduced.
What would be the outcome when the bucket breaks? Would lava suddenly spill onto the ground?

While I do think this is a cool idea, it just doesn't feel right. Buckets have always been a certain way. I do like the idea of having a netherite bucket that would be lava proof because when your filling up lots of buckets in the nether and you fill too much the buckets will be thrown out in front of you and if we had this then we wouldn't have to worry about the buckets burning up
To be honest, I think just adding a netherite bucket would be great since this would allow for the automation of lava collection since a netherite bucket won't burn.
At the very least, this could be used to create different styles, like having a blackstone furnace
Gold Buckets could also be another thing to barter or distract Piglins with. Netherite would just be lava proof
I agree with you I had the same idea
I should give my dogs a totem of undying, best idea MigM12000!

Moved to proper category.
Thanks for your contribution.
I made an idea similar to this good job!

The totem maybe can be put in leash of cats and dogs, like an accessory resembling a pendant, adding a lot of style. And in case of the dogs, alsowould demonstrate power and he'd let us know which of him can go to fight without fear of that they die (at least more than once).
You should rename it the collar of undying

1-3 totems could be used on wolves, cats, foxes, or parrots, allowing the player to:

â€¢ bring them on more outings without as much fear of loss.

â€¢ maintain another use for the totems thus increasing their value and encouraging them to engage with the illiger raids.

â€¢ make a tactical totem choice for either self-consumption or pet-protection.
I think when given to cats and wolves they should have the Totem of Undying visible as a charm on their collar!
It is a good idea, but it is too expensive to sacrifice a totem for a pet that you can easily tame again. And even with a totem, it still can die rapidly.
Slime blocks do that.
And trampolines don't fit the medieval fantasy theme.
I think this should be a creative only item like barriers

Instead of this, I think you should be able to open it up by right-clicking (for bedrock tap and hold for a second like you are breaking something) and it would open 5 different slots. If you put the blocks you want to randomize. Then from there you just act like you are placing a block with it in your hand and it would randomly place a block of the blocks in your wand. (I am just calling it a wand because it would probably be called the wand of randomization. This is what I think this should be like.
JacobLime728 the problem with that is that it could possibly be abused to act like shulker boxes in which they could hold blocks while in your inventory
instead of having the new tool work like a hopper, make it so the tool can "remember" a number of blocks (3 to 5) by "mining" an already existing block; something like a debug stick can handle blocks

Omg please create an option to remove these particles. This has been requested since atleast 2018. Many reddit posts asking for the removal. I literally never use a beacon because of how intrusive these particle effects are, no matter how useful beacons are.
This would be very nice! I think the paddle idea is good, but a bit complicated, however long boats would be great and a nice addition to the game.
Good idea :)
Ich wÃ¼rde es so machen, dass es einen speziellen Block gibt, der die BlÃ¶cke Platziert, sonst wÃ¼rden vielleicht viele Farms oder andere Bauten nicht mehr funktionieren.
How would it be craftable? Why wouldnâ€™t it hurt the player?
There will be iron in the middle. It will be crafted with magma blocks all around the end and 1 iron ingot in the middle.
Didn't answer why
Its called a grindstone...

That removes enchantments, not putting it on a special type of book or a normal type of book to be put onto other tools, armor, or weapons. Grindstones give experience, but this table takes it. Grindstones destroy the enchantments, this table destroys the equipment. Hopefully this helps you understand what I meant.
Yes. I understand and love this idea. Through fishing, I get 2-3 instances of mending in 5 rounds. It physically hurts to just put them in the grindstone.
